thread.title: CHAMP sells Alleasing to Monash Private Capital
thread.title_full: CHAMP sells Alleasing to Monash Private Capital | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: CHAMP sells Alleasing to Monash Private Capital
text:
Street Talk revealed 12-months ago that CHAMP, co-founded by Bill Ferris, had hired Credit Suisse to consider sale options for the equipment leasing company. Michelle Mossop by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald CHAMP Private Equity has sold its Alleasing business to independent private investment firm Monash Private Capital.
As revealed by Street Talk Online on Monday, the sale price was said to be about $190 million, while the transaction was funded by KKR and Highbridge Principal Strategies.
Former Alleasing boss Daniel Blizzard has also been appointed chief executive officer of Alleasing.
Monash is owned by its senior executives as well as external shareholders including Kirsh Group, one of the world's largest private companies, and Genesis Capital, a privately held financial services group.
Monash Chairman Geoff Levy AO said: "This is a long term investment for Monash in a quality, highly cash generative business with a talented team. Monash is a principal investor, not a private equity fund. That's a critical difference in our growth intent. We are all investing for the long-term success of this business."
Alleasing CEO Daniel Blizzard said: "I am delighted to partner with Monash to help Alleasing realise its potential by providing customers with bespoke solutions to financing specialised assets."
Monash was advised by MPC Strategic Solutions, Addisons, KPMG and Lewis King Blumberg.
Street Talk revealed 12-months ago that CHAMP had hired Credit Suisse to consider sale options for the equipment leasing company. CHAMP acquired the business from Allco Finance Group in 2008 for $146 million, according to S&P Capital IQ.
